title: Local Disk C or D for games?
body:
Hi,
So recently I bought a new Laptop. I just noticed that there are 2 partition of my 1 tera HDD( 400 gb c and 600 gb d). My windows 10 is installed on local disk c and therefore there are only 300mb-ish of free space in local c. My question is, is it better to install my games(including LOL) on Local Disk D? Will there any performance penalty (such as longer loading screen, lag, etc). Thank you

replies.body:
Is one of them a solid-state disk?  If so, installing it to there will give you *massively* reduced load times.

Note, however, that in the case of a game like League of Legends, having very low load times doesn't really matter because then you are just left waiting for all the other players to load.

League works best when installed to the default directory **(C:\Riot Games\League of Legends)** for a number of reasons. The biggest is that League interacts or utilizes files outside of the League folder, and is less likely to run into issues doing so when installed on the root drive of Windows (in this case, it's C:\)

Let me know if this cleared this up for you.
